member.name: T:MigraDoc.Capabilities.BackwardCompatibility
member.summary: Access to backward compatibility information via fluent API.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.Capabilities.BackwardCompatibility.TreatArgbZeroAsEmptyColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that defines what new Color(0) do. If false, which is the default value, the RGB color black with opacity 0 is created. If true, Color.Empty is created for backward compatibility to older code using the MigraDoc Document Object Model.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.Capabilities.BackwardCompatibility.DoNotCreateLastParagraph
member.summary: NYI

member.name: P:MigraDoc.Capabilities.BackwardCompatibility.DoNotCreateLastTable
member.summary: NYI

member.name: P:MigraDoc.Capabilities.BackwardCompatibility.DoNotCreateLastSection
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that defines what LastSection does if no section exists. If false, which is the default value, a new section is created and returned. If true, no section will be created and null is returned instead.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.Capabilities.BackwardCompatibility.DoNotUnifyTabStopHandling
member.summary: In RTF a single decimal tabstop in a table is a special case. In contrast to other tabstops, multiple tabstops in tables and decimal tabstops outside of tables, the content is here aligned to the tabstop without the need of a tab. Adding a tab in RTF would move the content to the next (not existing) tabstop and would perhaps result in an unwanted line break. Since Version 6.0.0 PDFsharp provides a consistent behavior through PDF and RTF generation and all tabstop usages. With that change a tab is always needed to reach a tabstop. To achieve this, the RTF TabStopsRenderer will render an additional left aligned tabstop at position 0, if TabStops is inside a cell and contains only one tabstop, which is set to decimal alignment and a position greater than 0. Set this property to true to reactivate the old behavior without any corrections for this special case by PDFsharp.

member.name: T:MigraDoc.Capabilities.Compatibility
member.summary: Compatibility settings for MigraDoc.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.Capabilities.Compatibility.ChartsCannotBeRendered
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that specifies if the renderer should silently ignore charts if they are not supported. Otherwise, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlParser.MoveToParagraphContent
member.summary: Shortcut for scanner.MoveToParagraphContent(). Moves to the first character the content of a paragraph starts with. Empty lines and comments are skipped. Returns true if such a character exists, and false if the paragraph ends without content.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlParser.MoveToNextParagraphContentLine(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shortcut for scanner.MoveToNextParagraphContentLine(). Moves to the first character of the content of a paragraph beyond an EOL. Returns true if such a character exists and belongs to the current paragraph. Returns false if a new line (at root level) or '}' occurs. If a new line caused the end of the paragraph, the DDL cursor is moved to the next valid content character or '}' respectively.

member.summary: Reads to the next DDL token. Comments are ignored.
member.returns: Returns the current symbol. It is Symbol.Eof if the end of the DDL string is reached.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.PeekKeyword
member.summary: Gets the next keyword at the current position without touching the DDL cursor.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.PeekKeyword(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the next keyword without touching the DDL cursor.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.PeekPunctuation(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the next punctuation terminal symbol without touching the DDL cursor.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.PeekSymbol
member.summary: Gets the next symbol without touching the DDL cursor.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.ReadText(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads either text or \keyword from current position.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.IgnoreLineBreak
member.summary: Returns whether the linebreak should be ignored because the previous symbol is already a whitespace.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.ReadPlainText(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Read text from current position until block ends or \keyword occurs.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.MoveToCode
member.summary: Moves to the next DDL token if Symbol is not set to a valid position.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.MoveToParagraphContent
member.summary: Moves to the first character the content of a paragraph starts with. Empty lines and comments are skipped. Returns true if such a character exists, and false if the paragraph ends without content.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.MoveToNextParagraphContentLine(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves to the first character of the content of a paragraph beyond an EOL. Returns true if such a character exists and belongs to the current paragraph. Returns false if a new line (at root level) or '}' occurs. If a new line caused the end of the paragraph, the DDL cursor is moved to the next valid content character or '}' respectively.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.MoveToNonWhiteSpaceOrEol
member.summary: If the current character is not a white space, the function immediately returns it. Otherwise, the DDL cursor is moved forward to the first non-white space or EOF. White spaces are SPACE, HT, VT, CR, and LF.???

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.MoveToNonWhiteSpace
member.summary: If the current character is not a white space, the function immediately returns it. Otherwise, the DDL cursor is moved forward to the first non-white space or EOF. White spaces are SPACE, HT, VT, CR, and LF.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.MoveBeyondEol
member.summary: Moves to the first character beyond the next EOL.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.IO.DdlScanner.ScanSingleLineComment
member.summary: Reads a single line comment.

member.summary: Move DDL cursor one character further.

member.summary: Move DDL cursor to the next EOL (or EOF).

member.summary: Appends current character to the token and reads next character.

member.summary: Appends all next characters to current token until end of line or end of file is reached. CR/LF or EOF is not part of the token.

member.summary: Represents a merged list of cells of a table.

member.summary: Enumeration of neighbor positions of cells in a table.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MergedCellList class.

member.summary: Initializes this instance from a table.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.IsAlreadyCovered(MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Tables.Cell)
member.summary: Returns whether the given cell is already covered by a preceding cell in this instance.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the cell at the specified position.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.GetEffectiveBordersRtf(MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Tables.Cell)
member.summary: Gets a borders object that should be used for RTF rendering. In RTF heading rows must not be considered, as repeated heading row rendering is done in the RTF application. Further, inserting rows later in the RTF application should not move or duplicate any heading row border formatting, that could otherwise be assigned here to the following row, down to the table content.
member.exception: Thrown when the cell is not in this list. This situation occurs if the given cell is merged "away" by a previous one.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.GetEffectiveBordersPdf(MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Tables.Cell,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a borders object that should be used for PDF rendering. In PDF heading rows must be considered, as repeated heading row rendering is done in PDF rendering Therefore the index of the last heading row (original, not repetition) must be committed.
member.exception: Thrown when the cell is not in this list. This situation occurs if the given cell is merged "away" by a previous one.

member.name: F:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList._effectiveBordersLookup
member.summary: A dictionary assigning the determined effective borders and the last known header insertion row index at that time to a cell for caching purposes. If a new last heading insertion row is known, the cached borders may have to be determined again.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.GetCoveringCell(MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Tables.Cell)
member.summary: Gets the cell that covers the given cell by merging. Usually the cell itself if not merged.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.GetBorderFromBorders(MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Borders,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.BorderType)
member.summary: Returns the border of the given borders-object of the specified type (top, bottom, ...). If that border doesn’t exist, it returns a new border object that inherits all properties from the given borders object.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.GetEffectiveBorderWidth(MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Borders,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.BorderType)
member.summary: Returns the width of the border at the specified position.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.GetNeighbor(System.Int32,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.NeighborPosition)
member.summary: Gets the specified cell’s uppermost neighbor at the specified position.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.GetNeighborTop(System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Gets the top neighbor of a cell. TopRowIndexOverride may be used to manually override the row index of the top neighbor row. For PDF effective border determination in case of heading repetitions the lastHeadingRow index can be used to get a cell in the original last heading row as neighbor instead of the last content row on the page before. Repetitions of the heading are not managed in MergedCellList (what would be wrong for RTF rendering), therefore jumping to the original header is necessary.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.IsNeighbor(MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Tables.Cell,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Tables.Cell,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.NeighborPosition)
member.summary: Returns whether cell2 is a neighbor of cell1 at the specified position.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.IsNeighborTop(MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Tables.Cell,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Tables.Cell,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns true, if cell2 is the top neighbor of cell1. TopRowIndexOverride may be used to manually override the top neighbor row index determined by cell1. For PDF effective border determination in case of heading repetitions the lastHeadingRow index can be used to get a cell in the original last heading row as neighbor instead of the last content row on the page before. Repetitions of the heading are not managed in MergedCellList (what would be wrong for RTF rendering), therefore jumping to the original header is necessary.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Visitors.MergedCellList.AddHeaderInsertionRowIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: After a heading has been inserted in PDF rendering, the index of the first following content row should be added here to consider this heading when determining the effective borders.

member.summary: Compares two color objects. True if both ARGB values are equal, false otherwise.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Color.op_Inequality(MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Color,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Color)
member.summary: Compares two color objects. True if both ARGB values are not equal, false otherwise.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Color.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the string and returns a color object. Throws ArgumentException if color is invalid. Supports four different formats for hex colors. Format 1: uses prefix "0x", followed by as many hex digits as needed. Important: do not forget the opacity, so use 7 or 8 digits. Format 2: uses prefix "#", followed by exactly 8 digits including opacity. Format 3: uses prefix "#", followed by exactly 6 digits; opacity will be 0xff. Format 4: uses prefix "#", followed by exactly 3 digits; opacity will be 0xff; "#ccc" will be treated as "#ffcccccc", "#d24" will be treated as "#ffdd2244".
member.param: integer, hex or color name.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Color.K

member.summary: Converts a string into a text phrase.

member.summary: Converts a string into a string literal (a quoted string).

member.summary: Scans the given string for characters which are invalid for identifiers. Strings are limited to 64 characters.

member.summary: Quotes the given name if it contains characters which are invalid for identifiers.

member.name: T:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Document
member.summary: Represents a MigraDoc document.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Document.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Document class.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Document.Culture
member.summary: Gets or sets the user-defined culture used for date formatting and decimal tabstop alignment. Note for RTF rendering: Decimal tabstop alignment is done in the viewing application and always depends on the system regional settings, as culture or separators cannot be saved in rtf.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Document.EffectiveCulture
member.summary: Gets the actual culture used for date formatting and decimal tabstop alignment. Note for RTF rendering: Decimal tabstop alignment is done in the viewing application and always depends on the system regional settings, as culture or separators cannot be saved in rtf.

member.summary: Creates a deep copy of this object.

member.summary: Implements the deep copy of the object.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Document.BindToRenderer(System.Object)
member.summary: Internal function used by a renderer to bind this instance to it.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Document.IsBoundToRenderer
member.summary: Indicates whether the document is bound to a renderer. A bound document must not be modified anymore. Modifying it leads to undefined results of the rendering process.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Document.AddSection
member.summary: Adds a new section to the document.

member.summary: Adds a new style to the document styles.

Name of the base style.

member.summary: Adds an embedded file to the document.

The path of the file to embed.

member.summary: Returns the last table in the document, or null if no table exists.

member.summary: The viewer application should behave in accordance with the current user preference.

member.summary: Targets a position in the document. Same as 'Bookmark'.

member.summary: Targets a position in the document. Same as 'Local'.

member.name: F:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.HyperlinkType.ExternalBookmark
member.summary: Targets a position in another PDF document. This is only supported in PDF. In RTF the other document is opened, but the target position is not moved to.

member.name: F:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.HyperlinkType.EmbeddedDocument
member.summary: Targets a position in an embedded document in this or another root PDF document. This is only supported in PDF.

member.summary: Targets a resource on the Internet or network. Same as 'Url'.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.FormattedText.AddHyperlink(System.String,System.String,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.HyperlinkTargetWindow)
member.summary: Adds a new Hyperlink of Type "ExternalBookmark", i.e. the target is a Bookmark in an external PDF Document.
member.param: The path to the target document.
The Named Destination’s name in the target document.
Defines if the document shall be opened in a new window. If not set, the viewer application should behave in accordance with the current user preference.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.FormattedText.AddHyperlinkToEmbeddedDocument(System.String,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.HyperlinkTargetWindow)
member.summary: Adds a new Hyperlink of Type "EmbeddedDocument". The target is a Bookmark in an embedded Document in this Document.
member.param: The path to the named destination through the embedded documents. The path is separated by '\' and the last segment is the name of the named destination. The other segments describe the route from the current (root or embedded) document to the embedded document holding the destination. ".." references to the parent, other strings refer to a child with this name in the EmbeddedFiles name dictionary.
Defines if the HyperlinkType ExternalBookmark shall be opened in a new window. If not set, the viewer application should behave in accordance with the current user preference.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.FormattedText.AddHyperlinkToEmbeddedDocument(System.String,System.String,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.HyperlinkTargetWindow)
member.summary: Adds a new Hyperlink of Type "EmbeddedDocument". The target is a Bookmark in an embedded Document in an external PDF Document.
member.param: The path to the target document.

The path to the named destination through the embedded documents in the target document. The path is separated by '\' and the last segment is the name of the named destination. The other segments describe the route from the root document to the embedded document. Each segment name refers to a child with this name in the EmbeddedFiles name dictionary.
Defines if the HyperlinkType ExternalBookmark shall be opened in a new window. If not set, the viewer application should behave in accordance with the current user preference.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Hyperlink.NoHyperlinkStyle
member.summary: If set to true, the Hyperlink shall look like the surrounding text without using the Hyperlink Style. May be used for text references, e.g. in tables, which shall not be rendered as links.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Hyperlink.Name
member.summary: For HyperlinkType Local/Bookmark: Gets or sets the target bookmark name of the Hyperlink. For HyperlinkTypes File and Url/Web: Gets or sets the target filename of the Hyperlink, e.g. a path to a file or an URL. For HyperlinkType ExternalBookmark: Not valid - throws Exception. This property is retained due to compatibility reasons.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Hyperlink.Filename
member.summary: Gets or sets the target filename of the Hyperlink, e.g. a path to a file or an URL. Used for HyperlinkTypes ExternalBookmark, File and Url/Web.

member.summary: Gets or sets the target bookmark name of the Hyperlink. Used for HyperlinkTypes ExternalBookmark and Bookmark.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Hyperlink.NewWindow
member.summary: Defines if the HyperlinkType ExternalBookmark shall be opened in a new window. If not set, the viewer application should behave in accordance with the current user preference.

member.summary: Gets or sets the target type of the Hyperlink.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.GetPageSize(MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageFormat,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Unit@,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Unit@)
member.summary: Gets the page’s size and height for the given PageFormat.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.SectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which defines whether the section starts on next, odd, or even page.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the page orientation of the section. If Orientation is set, the PageFormat will be rotated if necessary. If PageWidth and PageHeight are set, the actual orientation will be defined by width and height. This applies also if only one of those values is set and the other one is calculated according to PageFormat and Orientation values. A quadratic page is considered to be Portrait.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.PageWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the page width.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.EffectivePageWidth
member.summary: This is now the same as PageWidth.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.StartingNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting number for the first section page.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.PageHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the page height.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.ResetPageSize
member.summary: Resets PageWidth, PageHeight, PageFormat, and Orientation. Useful for example before defining a new page size for a cloned PageSetup. This ensures that no other previously set page size values will interfere with the newly set values.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.EffectivePageHeight
member.summary: This is now the same as PageHeight.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.TopMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the top margin of the pages in the section.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.BottomMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the bottom margin of the pages in the section.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.LeftMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the left margin of the pages in the section.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.RightMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the right margin of the pages in the section.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.OddAndEvenPagesHeaderFooter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which defines whether the odd and even pages of the section have different header and footer.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.DifferentFirstPageHeaderFooter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which define whether the section has a different first page header and footer.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.HeaderDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the header and the page top of the pages in the section.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.FooterDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the footer and the page bottom of the pages in the section.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.MirrorMargins
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which defines whether the odd and even pages of the section should change left and right margin.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.HorizontalPageBreak
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which defines whether a page should break horizontally. Currently only tables are supported.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.PageFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the page format of the section.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.Comment
member.summary: Gets or sets a comment associated with this object.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.PreviousPageSetup
member.summary: Gets the PageSetup of the previous section, or null if the page setup belongs to the first section.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.PageSetup.DefaultPageSetup
member.summary: Gets a PageSetup object with default values for all properties. User code must not change any value in DefaultPageSetup because these values are the reference used when persisting DOM objects in MDDDL files. Create "Clone()" of DefaultPageSetup and make the necessary changes.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Paragraph.AddHyperlink(System.String,System.String,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.HyperlinkTargetWindow)
member.summary: Adds a new Hyperlink of Type "ExternalBookmark", i.e. the target is a Bookmark in an external PDF Document.
member.param: The path to the target document.
The Named Destination’s name in the target document.
Defines if the HyperlinkType ExternalBookmark shall be opened in a new window. If not set, the viewer application should behave in accordance with the current user preference.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Paragraph.AddHyperlinkToEmbeddedDocument(System.String,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.HyperlinkTargetWindow)
member.summary: Adds a new Hyperlink of Type "EmbeddedDocument". The target is a Bookmark in an embedded Document in this Document.
member.param: The path to the named destination through the embedded documents. The path is separated by '\' and the last segment is the name of the named destination. The other segments describe the route from the current (root or embedded) document to the embedded document holding the destination. ".." references to the parent, other strings refer to a child with this name in the EmbeddedFiles name dictionary.
Defines if the HyperlinkType ExternalBookmark shall be opened in a new window. If not set, the viewer application should behave in accordance with the current user preference.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.Paragraph.AddHyperlinkToEmbeddedDocument(System.String,System.String,MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.HyperlinkTargetWindow)
member.summary: Adds a new Hyperlink of Type "EmbeddedDocument". The target is a Bookmark in an embedded Document in an external PDF Document.
member.param: The path to the target document.

The path to the named destination through the embedded documents in the target document. The path is separated by '\' and the last segment is the name of the named destination. The other segments describe the route from the root document to the embedded document. Each segment name refers to a child with this name in the EmbeddedFiles name dictionary.
Defines if the HyperlinkType ExternalBookmark shall be opened in a new window. If not set, the viewer application should behave in accordance with the current user preference.

member.name: M:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.TabStops.ClearAll
member.summary: Clears all TabStop objects from the collection. Additionally, 'TabStops = null' is written to the DDL stream when serialized.

member.name: P:MigraDoc.DocumentObjectModel.TabStops.TabsCleared
member.summary: Gets the information if the collection is marked as cleared. Additionally, 'TabStops = null' is written to the DDL stream when serialized. Further setting TabsCleared to true can be used to suppress inheriting TabStops, if needed for a user interface allowing interactive editing and just-in-time calculation of the effective style based on inheritance. This concept differs from Word’s object model, which seems to retain a list of TabStop positions to remove, if inherited TabStops are removed in Word’s Style editing dialog.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers
member.summary: Extension method GetSubArray required for the built-in range operator (e.g.'[1..9]'). Fun fact: This class must be compiled into each assembly. If it is only visible through InternalsVisibleTo code will not compile with .NET Framework 4.6.2 and .NET Standard 2.0.
